name: Drinkstone Park Bed and Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I try and be original in anything I write. It has taken me so long to write a review for Drinkstone Park because I cannot think of anything different to say from what other reviewers have said. Michael and Christine have a talent for what they do. Drinkstone is the only b&b I have suggested to the wife that we go back to just to stay there and for no other reason. It was the ideal place to finish our tour of East Anglia (it's the guy in the 'sporty' red Honda speaking, Michael). We have stayed in some excellent b&bs over the years but Drinkstone tops them all. Quite exceptional.
reviews.title: Quite Exceptional

reviews.text: Having enjoyed a relaxing break here in May, we really wanted to make a return visit, so we 4 booked in for a 4 night stay. On arrival, Michael & Christine welcomed us back like old friends. We were more than happy with our bedrooms, the Red & Peach, and we all enjoyed Christine's afternoon teas, with her delicious homemade scones, served in the Guest lounge. The highlight of every morning was breakfast. Christine's menu was extensive, with a daily 'specials' board, a range of stewed & fresh fruits, homemade preserves and Michael's honey, eggs from their hens, and local bacon and sausages. Added to this, Michael served us with skill, and kept us entertained with his unique humour. It was good to see the gardens in a different season, too. Now, we can't wait to come back again!
reviews.title: Return visit.

reviews.text: I stayed at Drinkstone Park for two nights in September in order to attend a wedding in Bury St Edmunds. I did not know the area and relied on Trip Advisor reviews to help me to make a choice of where to stay. I was not disappointed! From my first phone call to my final departure(via the village fete), I was made to feel thoroughly welcomed and comfortable. I was not the easiest of guests, either. I arrived late in the evening and, having got myself lost in dark country lanes, had to be rescued by Michael, who set out in the rain to find me. Taxis to the venue of the wedding were expensive, so, again, Michael took me there and collected me!
reviews.title: Superlative

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Christine and Michael make a happily united team and their breakfasts are stunningly good. Everything is freshly cooked and the eggs are from Drinkstone Park's own hens.The bedroom and bathroom was equipped with everything I could possibly need - even low fat Horlicks!
reviews.title: Very relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The gardens are magnificent and the views from them, stunning. I spent so long exploring the gardens and relaxing in the sunshine that I was very nearly late for the wedding!
reviews.title: Excellent stay for a couple of nights

aka: Drinkstone Park Bed And Breakfast Bury St. Edmunds, Suffolk
description: Award Winning Bed and Breakfast on the edge of the village of Drinkstone close to Bury St Edmunds. Quiet, comfortable and welcoming with an excellent breakfast & more.We are situated in three acres of beautiful gardens that once formed part of the Drinkstone Park estate. Quiet and secluded yet only a short drive to the A14 and easy access to the major road networks. A ten minute drive to Bury St Edmunds. We look forward to welcoming you to our home. Michael & Christine
